$interpreted: Aosta: Nothing has changed...those past memories... how nostalgic...wouldn't you say, professor Dietrich?
Annie: Hey hey hey, why did the headmaster scold Elio?
Betty: Appears that he wants to drop out of the Academy and participate in the war alongside the Kingdom of the Sun's princess.
Annie: You mean the princess' conscription order? I've received the news as well, but my dad told me that she's a traitor. Will she really get anyone to join?
Cara: Apparently Leah's joining, though she said it's only because she wants to see her younger brother...oh, headmaster is here. We better go.
Charle: As headmaster, I have no say in the students' desires. However, as a father, I will not allow you to go through with your decision.
Elio: But...I have my own ideals and goals. I also want to experience the world by myself.
Charle: The reality of the outside world is very different from life inside Rune Academy. On top of it all, you're participating in a war. You will get injured!
Elio: Father, please believe in me. I am strong enough to face what life throws at me.
Aosta: So you two are father and son...how surprising. The fact that you're a doting, overprotective dad, is even more surprising to me.
Charle: You have no business speaking about our relationship. Leave, now.
Aosta: Professor Dietrich used to say that "power is everything." Why not have a simulation battle with him?
Aosta: See if he's really capable of surviving the outside world?
Charle: I said, you have no...
Elio: ...I agree.
Elio: If this is the only way for father to see my determination, then I will challenge father right here, right now.
Charle: Alright. However, if I win, you will have to listen to me!
Elio: Understood!
Elio: Father, let's begin!
Elio: ...F-Father... I won...
Charle: ......
Charle: You are now free to do whatever you desire.
Aosta: (How foolish, if he could properly gauge how serious he wanted to be, maybe he wouldn't have accidentally lost.)
Aosta: (But those spells the boy just cast...no, that's not possible...)

Model.Text: Nothing has changed...those past memories... how nostalgic...wouldn't you say, professor Dietrich?
Hey hey hey, why did the headmaster scold Elio?
Appears that he wants to drop out of the Academy and participate in the war alongside the Kingdom of the Sun's princess.
You mean the princess' conscription order? I've received the news as well, but my dad told me that she's a traitor. Will she really get anyone to join?
Apparently Leah's joining, though she said it's only because she wants to see her younger brother...oh, headmaster is here. We better go.
As headmaster, I have no say in the students' desires. However, as a father, I will not allow you to go through with your decision.
But...I have my own ideals and goals. I also want to experience the world by myself.
The reality of the outside world is very different from life inside Rune Academy. On top of it all, you're participating in a war. You will get injured!
Father, please believe in me. I am strong enough to face what life throws at me.
So you two are father and son...how surprising. The fact that you're a doting, overprotective dad, is even more surprising to me.
You have no business speaking about our relationship. Leave, now.
Professor Dietrich used to say that "power is everything." Why not have a simulation battle with him?
See if he's really capable of surviving the outside world?
I said, you have no...
...I agree.
If this is the only way for father to see my determination, then I will challenge father right here, right now.
Alright. However, if I win, you will have to listen to me!
Understood!
Father, let's begin!
...F-Father... I won...
You are now free to do whatever you desire.
(How foolish, if he could properly gauge how serious he wanted to be, maybe he wouldn't have accidentally lost.)
(But those spells the boy just cast...no, that's not possible...)
